result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly J Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(3rd+ w/in3Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly J Meyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:03 p.m. Defendant Kelly J Meyer in court, in custody, appears via video from the WC Jail with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE previously has an IA with a scheduled P/S.  DE failed to appear for the P/S. Atty Szilagyi - DE is motivated to resolve but is requesting additional time to prepare for the jail sentence. ADA Anderson - does not object to proceeding today and allowing the defendant time to report to serve the additional jail time. The defendant waives right to be personally present in the courtroom. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Statement by Atty Szilagyi regarding sentencing. Court orders: 10 days WCJ - Huber, GT,  4 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than March 4, 2016, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP,  DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

Case called @ 2:34 p.m. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests matter be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:11 p.m. Defendant Kelly J Meyer in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $500 Sig Bond. Statement by Atty Szilagyi regarding bond. Court orders $500 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 03:20 pm.
